possibly.translation[0].definitions[0].d: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain
possibly.translation[0].definitions[0].e: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
‘Was it murder?’ ‘Quite possibly  (=it is very likely).’
possibly.translation[0].definitions[1].d: used to emphasize that you are very surprised or shocked by something, or you cannot understand it
possibly.translation[0].definitions[1].e: How could anyone possibly do such a thing?
possibly.translation[0].definitions[2].d: used to emphasize that someone will do or has done everything they can to help or to achieve something
possibly.translation[0].definitions[2].e: We shall be contributing as much as we possibly can to the campaign.
Doctors did everything they possibly could to save his life.
possibly.translation[0].definitions[3].d: used to emphasize that you cannot do something, or that something cannot or could not happen or be done
possibly.translation[0].definitions[3].e: I can’t possibly allow you to go home in this weather.
She couldn’t possibly have heard what was said.
